text: On tap @BBF16. The aroma has iodine, medicines, booze. Black coloured beer with no head. The taste is very boozy, bit sweet, medicinal, peaty. Not much of the delicate Esra left. Rather thin bodied for an eisbock. To put it nicely; it is not really good.

23rd September 2016Borefts VIII. Day 1. Keg. Opaque dark brown beer, thin pale tan head. Smooth palate, slightly oily feel. Modest fine cabonation. Spicy dark malts. Spicy peaty whiskey. Some emulsion paint. Spicy finish. Impressive beer engineering but not a peat fan so hard to get the best from this one.

On tap at Borefts Bier Festival, 2016. Courtesy of markoijelena. Pours dark brown, minimal tan head. Chocolate, malty, peat, whisky, wood, roast. Sweet. Quite drinkable for the abv, that came as bit of surprise. Full bodied. Warming, light alcohol. Pretty good.

23/IX/16 - on tap @ Borefts Bier Festival - BB: n/a (2016-1067) Thanks to the Belgian ratebeer crew for sharing todays beers!
Clear black beer, no head. Aroma: alcohol, banana peel, peated, chemical, earthy, sweet. MF: no carbon, full body. Taste: very astringent, unpleasant bitterness, alcohol. Aftertaste: overripe fruits, very disturbing. I dont know what they did here, bit clearly it didnt work. At least not for me.
Sample at Borefts 2016. Black beer, Aroma is whiksy, alcohol, Taste is the same and somewhat the same as the normal version. but very good.

Draft at Borefts De Molen Beer Festival 2016 Bodegraven, The Netherlands. 23.09.2016. Pour it dark color with medium white head. Aroma of milk chocolate and some red fruits. Taste too much sweet, some apples, booze, chocolate, again alcohol kick sweet, ok not so perfectly balanced, interesting to try, woody finish, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish.

[9/23/16] Draught sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2016 in Bodegraven. Day one. Black with a bit of tan foam. Huge peaty aroma with roast, chocolate. Roasty flavor, peaty, sweet, with chocolate, whiskey, coffee, wood. Full-bodied.
At BBF, opaque black color, aroma of chocolate carob and a hint of vanila, sweet chocolate flavor with dark fruits and prunes. Nice.
At Borefts 2016. thnx for sharing,everyone ! Pours dark brown, small white head. Smell is hot, whisky, intense roast, booze. taste is intense, mild peat, dark chocolate, intense roast. Very thick .
Tap @ Borefts. Black. Malt, whisky, just a hint of peat, caramel, roast and chocolate in the aroma. Malty sweet, warming alcohol, oak. Bowmore is clearly present. Low on carbon. Absolutely great.
Tasted at Borefts Bier Festival 2016 at De Molen. Sherry, dry, spicy, bitter, boozy, roasted, sweet and smooth.

Thank you for sharing BE RB Crew! Sampled draft @ Borefts 2016. Day 1. Pure black just like my soul  probably tastes just like that as well. Smell is pure alcoholic, harsh poor white spirit alcohol with overly big raw peat; taste is just harsh varnish, purely alcoholic, pure white grain, nail polish, massive unbalanced peat. Ashes. Thick basically flat varnish boozy syrup. I disliked the base beer so there is no surprise that I dislike the Eisbock version as well. I feel about the same about the both of them.

Draught at Borefts 16. Black with almost no head. Full body with almost no carbonation. Quite sweet with still some bitterness. Booze, coffee, chocolate, bourbon, caramel and roasted malts. Quite OK for an IJsbock.

On tap at Borefts 2016. Black with a beige head. Aroma is grape skins, booze, fig, dark fruits. Full bodied, sticky mouthfeel, slightly astringent and boozy finish. Taste is grape skins, dark fruits, whisky.

Tick @ Borefts 2016. Dark color, virtually no head. Aroma of spiritus, paint thinner, some roast, alcohol, tar, peat, iodine, medicine. Alcoholic in taste, peat, medicine. Horrible for a beer. Basicly, its a spirited up version of a Bowmore recreated by freezedistilling a Bowmore BA beer. Horrible. Had to rate this, to get rid of the Eisbock craze.

Draft at Borefts 2016, Day 1. Very dark brown with a ring tan head. Aroma of whiskey, oak, caramel, malt, toffee, booze and molasses. Flavour is heavy sweet. Full bodied with a thick texture, alcohol warmth and very soft carbonation. [23-09-2016]

van tap @Borefts 2016, bourbon bowmore ijsbock, zwart met minimale kraag, nou ja lacing. aroma van hop, laurier, chocolade, geroosterde en gebrande mout, bourbon, alcohol. Smaken van chocolade, dik en stroperig, enorm stevig, alcoholisch, cacao, ach ja t is een ijsbock, vond de reguliere versie lekker.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2016 On tap@ borefest:
Pours dark brown with almost no head. Aroma and flavors: toffee, caranel, dark chocolate, peat-ash, vanilla, tannins, strong alcohol note, which takes on port wine, cognac, whisky. Body is full, texture soft, carbonation is low.

24.09.2016, tap @ Borefts:
No head. Aroma is dry boozy, fresh oak, minerals, booze, bark, burnt sugar, weeds, peat. Taste is dry mineraly, weeds, bark, oak, minerals, burnt sugar, hay, grass, peat, hints of alcohol. Medium bitterness, dry mineraly mouthfeel. Fair enough, alcohol very well hidden in the taste.
Sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2016, Day 1. Opaque pitch black color, virtually no head. Smell and taste malts, heavy alcohol, heavy barrel aging. Over the top for me.
Black with thin head. Aroma of booze, wood, iodine. Flavour is woody and dry but sweetens up in the finish

Small sample from tap @ BBF 16. Black color. No head. Aromas of green apples, booze, with some acetone retronasal - not quite the way I like it. Flavor is moderate sweet with fruity sourness. Strong alcohol feel. Full body, syruppy. Finishes hot from the alcohol, but no new flavors.

Sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2016. Sehr dunkel braune Farbe, geringe beige Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv röstmalzig, süß, holzig, bourbon, rote Früchte. Geschmack intensiv röstmalzig, rote Früchte, holzig, alkoholisch.
UPDATED: SEP 29, 2016 At Borefts 2016. Aroma of booze, red fruit and creamy chocolate. Taste has lots of booze, red fruit and chocolate. Not bad, but somewhat one-dimensional.

Draught @ Borefts16: Served in a taster:
Black body, no head.
Nose of iodine, soy, peat, roast...
Flavours of wood, roast, prunes, earthy, peat...
Aftertaste is bitter, roast, peat, earthy...
Low carbo, silky mouthfeel, full bodied
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: shared sample at BBF, poured deep black pretty flat with no head on top. nose of intense alcohol heatd, roast, burned caramel, whisky, peat smoke, ash, vanilla, smoke, a bit sticky in the finish.

Tap. Dark brown color with ruby highlight and small head. Aroma is intense wood and raisins, some smoke and saltiness. Taste is smoke, salty, raisins, chocolate, extremely full-bodied, but very balanced and no hint of the 18% there. Extremely good.

On tap at Borefts 2016, Bodegraven.
Nose is whiskey. 
Body is black, flat. 
Aroma is chemical, milk chocolate, chocolate liquor, licorice, herbs. 
Medium to heavy sweet, medium bitter. 
Finish is long lasting roasty medium bittersweet, heavy alcohol warmth. 
Full body, oily texture, flat carbonation.
Heavy dessert beer, tasty but weird as expected, nice one.

On tap at Borefts 2016. Black murky colour thin white head. Its decent s9me of the base beer comes through deep dark malts chocolate and espresso coffee. Some heat no doubt. Some iced vanilla. Yes a lot better than i was expecting. Some whisky a little peat. Fine though and drinkable enough.

Sampled from tap at Borefts 2016 day 1. Black with creme head. Big sweet roasted chocolate and caramel malts. Spices, big alcoholic. Big sweet, medium bitter. Medium body, low carbonation. Thin alcoholic feel. Big roasty alcoholic spiced finish.

Tap at Borefts. Murky very dark brown with barely any head. Lots of chocolate, peat, sweet malts, lots of scotch, alcohol, earthy notes, light medicinal. Very sweet with alcoholic bitterness. Full bodied.
Keg at borefts. Pours black, nose is toffee, chocolate, peat, taste is similar, dry, wood.
Süßlicher, malzig alkoholischer Antrunk. Weich, sehr süffig, schokoladig. Süffig, erstaunlich kurzer Nachhall. 10/10/11/12//12
Keg at borefts 2016... Dark black.. Thin tan lacing.. Soft meaty chocolate malts.. Heavy Roast malts.. Boozy malts.. Heavy chocolate Roast.. Dark meaty boozy malts
